49.eng-name: The Book of the Etiquette of Judges

hadiths.text: It was narrated from Shuraih bin Hani' from his father, that:When he came to the Messenger of Allah [SAW] and he heard them calling Hani' by the nickname of Abu Al-Hakam, the Messenger of Allah [SAW] called him and said to him: "Allah is Al-Hakam (the Judge) and judgment is His. Why are you known as Abu Al-Hakam?" He said: "If my people differ concerning something, they come to me, and I pass judgment among them, and both sides accept it." He said: "How good this is. Do you have any children?" He said: "I have Shuraih, and 'Abdullah, and Muslim." He said: "Who is the eldest of them?" He said: "Shuraih." He said: "Then you are Abu Shuraih," and he supplicated for him and his son

chapter.ara-name: باب إِذَا حَكَّمُوا رَجُلاً فَقَضَى بَيْنَهُمْ
chapter.eng-name: If People Appoint a Man as Judge, and He Passes Judgment Among Them
